item.title: Spit Test May Reveal The Severity Of A Child's Concussion
item.description: May 4, 2017 - By measuring fragments of genetic material in saliva, scientists were able to accurately predict whether a young person's concussion symptoms would last days or weeks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - By measuring fragments of genetic material in saliva, scientists were able to accurately predict whether a young person's concussion symptoms would last days or weeks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526782407/spit-test-may-reveal-the-severity-of-a-child-s-concussion

item.title: The Daredevils Without Landlines â€” And Why Health Experts Are Tracking Them
item.description: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile telephones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile telephones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2015/12/03/458225197/the-daredevils-without-landlines-and-why-health-experts-are-tracking-them

item.title: House Republican Leaders Plan Vote On Revised Health Care Bill
item.description: May 3, 2017 - House Republican leaders are planning a vote on the American Health Care Act on Thursday. The bill has been revised to provide options for states to opt out of some key Obamacare requirements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - House Republican leaders are planning a vote on the American Health Care Act on Thursday. The bill has been revised to provide options for states to opt out of some key Obamacare requirements. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526810299/house-republican-leaders-plan-vote-on-revised-health-care-bill

item.title: House To Vote On GOP Health Care Bill Thursday With Leadership Sure Of Support
item.description: May 3, 2017 - After a series of changes, including one to create federal high-risk pools, the Republicans' health care plan is headed back to the House floor for a vote. The majority leader says it will pass.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - After a series of changes, including one to create federal high-risk pools, the Republicans' health care plan is headed back to the House floor for a vote. The majority leader says it will pass. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526771424/is-the-gop-health-bill-morphing-into-yet-another-big-federal-program

item.title: Trump Lobbies House Republicans To Vote For Health Care Bill
item.description: May 3, 2017 - President Trump personally lobbied House Republicans on Wednesday to vote for the revised GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - President Trump personally lobbied House Republicans on Wednesday to vote for the revised GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526779483/trump-lobbies-house-republicans-to-vote-for-health-care-bill

item.title: Unfounded Autism Fears Are Fueling Minnesota's Measles Outbreak
item.description: May 3, 2017 - State health officials are struggling to contain a measles outbreak that has sickened mostly Somali-American children. The vaccination rate is low in this tight community that's worried about autism.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - State health officials are struggling to contain a measles outbreak that has sickened mostly Somali-American children. The vaccination rate is low in this tight community that's worried about autism. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526723028/autism-fears-fueling-minnesotas-measles-outbreak

item.title: Understanding The History Behind Communities' Vaccine Fears
item.description: May 3, 2017 - A measles outbreak in Minnesota's Somali-American community is the latest example of the challenges public health officials face in addressing deeply ingrained concerns about vaccine safety.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - A measles outbreak in Minnesota's Somali-American community is the latest example of the challenges public health officials face in addressing deeply ingrained concerns about vaccine safety. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526595475/understanding-the-history-behind-communities-vaccine-fears

item.title: Urgent Care Services For Cancer Patients Offer A Gentler ER Alternative
item.description: May 3, 2017 - Some hospitals and oncology practices are setting up urgent care sites tailored to the needs of cancer patients, to help keep them out of the emergency room when complications or side effects arise.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - Some hospitals and oncology practices are setting up urgent care sites tailored to the needs of cancer patients, to help keep them out of the emergency room when complications or side effects arise. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526594004/urgent-care-services-for-cancer-patients-offer-a-gentler-er-alternative

item.title: Porn Star Plays New Role As Advocate For Industry Workers
item.description: May 3, 2017 - This week on 'Brave New Workers': After 20 years working as a performer in the adult entertainment industry, Alana Evans is putting her efforts into organizing for the Adult Performers Actors Guild.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - This week on 'Brave New Workers': After 20 years working as a performer in the adult entertainment industry, Alana Evans is putting her efforts into organizing for the Adult Performers Actors Guild. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/30/526038437/porn-star-plays-new-role-as-advocate-for-industry

item.title: Man Who Claimed To Be 146 Years Old Dies In Indonesia
item.description: May 3, 2017 - An Indonesian who claimed to have been born in 1870 died this week. If true, at 146, he would have been the oldest person ever by far. Indonesia didn't record births until 1900, however.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - An Indonesian who claimed to have been born in 1870 died this week. If true, at 146, he would have been the oldest person ever by far. Indonesia didn't record births until 1900, however. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526690256/man-who-claimed-to-be-146-years-old-dies-in-indonesia

item.title: As House GOP Struggles With A Health Care Bill, Republican Options Narrow
item.description: May 3, 2017 - Despite pressure from the White House and GOP leaders, Republicans have not yet secured enough votes to get health care replacement through the House, let alone the Senate. So, what are their choices?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - Despite pressure from the White House and GOP leaders, Republicans have not yet secured enough votes to get health care replacement through the House, let alone the Senate. So, what are their choices? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526622567/as-house-gop-struggles-with-a-health-care-bill-republican-options-narrow

item.title: More Salt In School Lunch, Less Nutrition Info On Menus: Trump Rolls Back Food Rules
item.description: May 2, 2017 - The Trump administration says it wants to remove burdensome regulation. On Monday it served up a taste of what that looks like when it comes to aspects of Obama-era food policy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - The Trump administration says it wants to remove burdensome regulation. On Monday it served up a taste of what that looks like when it comes to aspects of Obama-era food policy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/02/526448646/trump-administration-rolls-back-obama-era-rules-on-calorie-counts-school-lunch

item.title: A Child's Suffering Drives A Mother To Seek Untested Treatments
item.description: May 2, 2017 - When medication wasn't relieving her 3-year-old son's juvenile arthritis, Susannah Meadows started investigating non-medical treatments like diet and supplements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - When medication wasn't relieving her 3-year-old son's juvenile arthritis, Susannah Meadows started investigating non-medical treatments like diet and supplements. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526436381/a-childs-suffering-drives-a-mother-to-seek-untested-treatments

item.title: Death Rate Among Black Americans Declines, Especially For Elderly People
item.description: May 2, 2017 - The CDC says the death rate for black Americans fell 25 percent over 17 years and was especially dramatic for those 65 and older. But young black people are still dying earlier than white Americans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - The CDC says the death rate for black Americans fell 25 percent over 17 years and was especially dramatic for those 65 and older. But young black people are still dying earlier than white Americans. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526433607/death-rate-among-black-americans-declines-especially-for-elderly-people

item.title: Doctors Prescribe More Generics When Drug Reps Are Kept At Bay
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Doctors were more likely to choose generic drugs over pricier brand names when teaching hospitals limited access by pharmaceutical sales representatives, a study finds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Doctors were more likely to choose generic drugs over pricier brand names when teaching hospitals limited access by pharmaceutical sales representatives, a study finds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526558565/doctors-prescribe-more-generics-when-drug-reps-are-kept-at-bay
